class.name: Brand Filter Interaction and Product Count Consistency on Run Page

test-method.name: Verify product count for New Balance remains consistent after applying Adidas filter with specific price range

exception.message: Given The user is on the Wiggle main page...................................passed When The user navigates to the "Run" category page..........................passed When The user applies a price filter for range "£250 to £500"...............passed And The user observes the initial product count for brand "New Balance".....passed When The user selects the brand "adidas"....................................passed Then The product count for brand "New Balance" should remain visible and be the same as the initial count.failed
exception.full-stacktrace: java.lang.AssertionError: Product count for brand 'New Balance' has changed or is incorrect. Expected: '4', Actual: '0_EMPTY_FILTER_VALUE'. This indicates a deviation from expected behavior (defect might be present or logic changed). expected [4] but found [0_EMPTY_FILTER_VALUE] at org.testng.Assert.fail(Assert.java:111) at org.testng.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:1578) at org.testng.Assert.assertEqualsImpl(Assert.java:150) at org.testng.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:132) at org.testng.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:656) at com.stv.bdd.steps.ProductFilterSteps.productCountForBrandShouldRemainVisibleAndBeSameAsInitial(ProductFilterSteps.java:99) at ✽.The product count for brand "New Balance" should remain visible and be the same as the initial count(file:///C:/Users/User/Downloads/autoframeWork-template-Java_2025-Katsiaryna-Schastnaya/paraBankForStudents/src/test/resources/com/stv/bdd/features/BrandFilterDefect.feature:18)
